page.title: 13TRANSPORT AROUND GLAMIS
page.content: Almost every family in the Glamis area has the use of one (or more) motor vehicles. These are either owned by the family or are provided by the employer of one of the family. Most pensioners have near relatives or friends with cars who take them on regular shopping trips. Teenage boys favour Japanese motor cycles and nearly all the younger children have bicycles. Before the car came to be so popular and considered a necessity, there were regular and frequent bus services to Dundee, Kirriemuir and Forfar. During the current transition from monopoly nationalised bus services to private competitive services, there is a trial reorganisation of local routes. The aim is to provide economic services for travel to work and shops.
